case_title: Messrs AL-NOOR through Partner vs The PROVINCE OF SINDH through Chief Secretary Sindh and 8 others
respondant: The PROVINCE OF SINDH through Chief Secretary Sindh

accussed_details.name: N/A
allegation: Violation of Sindh Public Procurement Act, 2009
Misinterpretation of Clause 11.3.4 of SPPRA Regulations
Acceptance of bids in paisas instead of rupees

complaint_summary: Plaintiff alleged favoritism and manipulation in awarding seven government tenders, claiming bids were fraudulently ignored despite compliance with submission requirements. They also argued that Clause 11.3.4 was misinterpreted and bids in paisas were improperly accepted.
investigation_summary: Plaintiff presented evidence of bid submission, including Pay Orders verified by the bank and attendance records. KDA failed to provide original minutes of proceedings and relied on an evaluation report prepared after the tenders were opened. The Engineer's Estimate appeared exaggerated, favoring specific bidders.
judgment_summary: The court found the tender process lacked transparency and was tainted with favoritism. It set aside the award of tenders, ordered re-advertisement with revised Engineer's Estimates, and ruled that bids quoted in paisas shall not be considered.
Decision_or_verdict: Application allowed; award of tenders set aside.
legal_arguments: Plaintiff argued that bids were ignored despite compliance and presence during submission.
Plaintiff's bids were equal to or less than 30% below the Engineer's Estimate.
Defendants claimed Plaintiff did not submit bids and failed to approach the Grievance Redressal Committee.
Court ruled that Plaintiff's evidence of Pay Orders and attendance sheet supported their claim of participation.
Clause 11.3.4 was misapplied, and bids calculated up to 9 digits after decimal were deemed improper.
citations: Messrs Facto Belarus Tractors Limited Karachi v. Federation of Pakistan (PLD 2006 Sindh 479)
Asaf Fasihuddin v. Government of Pakistan (2014 SCMR 676)
GETZ Pharma (Pvt) Limited v. Province of Sindh (PLD 2016 Sindh 479)

witness_statement.Plaintiff's representative: Confirmed presence during bid submission and recitation of Quran verses at the opening proceedings.

key_issues: Acceptance of bids in paisas instead of rupees

maxims.De minimis: The law does not concern itself with trifles.

words_and_phrases.Favoritism: Unfair preference shown to certain bidders.

summary_vector_notes: The judgment highlights issues of favoritism, lack of transparency, and misinterpretation of procurement rules. It emphasizes the importance of realistic Engineer's Estimates, proper acknowledgment procedures, and rejecting bids quoted in paisas to ensure fairness.
